info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:22PM EDT until August 12 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MCDOWELL...CENTRAL RUTHERFORD AND SOUTHEASTERN POLK COUNTIES... At 622 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Marion to 9 miles north of Forest City to 13 miles west of Gaffney, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Forest City, Rutherfordton, Spindale, Bostic, Lake James State Park, Lake James, Nebo, Thermal City, Glenwood and Harris. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
